meanings.definition: Living or growing in natural conditions; not domesticated or cultivated.
meanings.sent1: The wild flowers bloomed beautifully in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The forest is full of wild animals like bears and deer.
meanings.sent3: The wild squirrel stole all the nuts from the bird feeder!
meanings.sent4: Her wild imagination took her on a journey through space and time.
meanings.sent5: The wild storm raged through the night, shaking the windows.

meanings.sent1: The wild child ran around the playground with endless energy.
meanings.sent2: The party turned into a wild celebration with music and dancing.
meanings.sent3: His wild laughter echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent4: The wild river flooded its banks, causing chaos in the town.
meanings.sent5: The wild wind whipped through the trees, scattering leaves everywhere.

meanings.sent1: The wild students were loud and disruptive in class.
meanings.sent2: The puppy was so wild, it chewed up all the shoes in the house.
meanings.sent3: Her wild behavior at the party shocked everyone.
meanings.sent4: The wild driver sped through the streets, ignoring all traffic rules.

meanings.definition: Marked by intense emotion or passion.
meanings.sent1: Her wild excitement for the upcoming concert was contagious.
meanings.sent2: The actor's performance was so wild, it left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent3: His wild love for her was evident in every gesture.
meanings.sent4: The wild cheers of the crowd filled the stadium with energy.
meanings.sent5: The wild joy of winning the game brought tears to his eyes.
